ext_descriptions.ext_description: The schema_name constant specifies an uppercase representation of the name of the present Express schema.

A moments_of_inertia_representation is a type of representation that describes the law of inertia of a rigid body.
The 9 inertia values are represented as a list_representation_item containing 3 elements, each describing one row of the inertia matrix, and each having 3 elements that describe the columns of each row.

The moments_of_inertia_representation shall contain exactly one representation_item in its set of items.
This representation_item shall be of type compound_representation_item and have a name of 'moments of inertia matrix'.

The compound_representation_item that is contained in the moments_of_inertia_representation shall reference exactly three representation_items.
These representation_items shall of type compound_representation_item and reached through list_representation_item.
Each of these compound_representation_items references three measure_representation_items through list_representation_item.

The restrict_centre_of_mass_representation rule specifies that each instance of representation with a name of 'centre of mass' shall contain exactly one item in its set of items. This representation_item shall be of type point and shall have a name of 'centre point'.
This rule enforces the requirement for every Centre_of_mass to have exactly one centre point.

Each instance of representation with a name of 'centre of mass' shall contain exactly one item in its set of items. This representation_item shall be of type point and shall have a name of 'centre point'.

The value_range_aggregate_rep_item function accepts an AGGREGATE of type representation_item as input and returns a boolean result. The function will return TRUE if the elements of the AGGREGATE repesent a 3x3 matrix of measure_representation_items. Else it will return FALSE.
This function is used in the second local rule of moments_of_inertia_representation.
The aggregate of instances of representation_item that is evaluated.
